creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Margaret McMillan Webber in memory of her mother, Katherine Kittredge McMillan
text: These two pages have been excerpted from an Iranian Koran, made at a time when Arabic script, the original language in which god revealed the Koran to the Prophet Muhammad, began to rival the local language of Pahlavi for literary preeminence. The angular letters are in Kufic script, a type of calligraphy that was developed in part to embellish god’s words.  Copying Korans in this period was considered an expression of faith.
title: Page from the Koran
